Review: I was supposed to be connected on 17 April. They told me a couple of days before the 17th that city fiber engineers faced a challenge. They call me and explain that they will get the next update around the 30th. I call them on the 30th and they have no update! They told me that I will be connected by 8 May. I wait again and call them a couple of days before the 8th. It turns out that city fiber wants me to get a consent from my neighbor to dig in their garden. I find this request ridiculous and also very unspecific (how much of their garden do they need to dig?). I ask specific questions and wait again for a couple of days. Then they now tell me that an engineer can attend and explain what needs to be done but the earliest they can do is the 29th of May.Before choosing Vodafone, one thing I should have realized is that they rely on City Fiber for connecting my home to the network. They may promise a date but that is if only everything goes well. This is different from a company that actually owns a fiber network.Even within the providers depending on City Fiber‚Äôs network, I think I would choose a different one because I get the sense that Vodafone does not take any proactive steps to connect me as soon as possible. They have not called me once since the challenge became obvious. If I hadn‚Äôt called them and asked what is going on, I wouldn‚Äôt have received any updates. They seem to have no way to prioritize me even though I am waiting to be connected for three weeks.EDIT: the copy and paste reply to this review accurately summarizes my experience. They are extremely friendly but do not listen to customers.
Name: RT

Review: When I set up my broadband and phone, the site kept crashing on me. So I ended up joining over the phone.  I've never been able to login in. I can't reset the password either, as the reset code message never gets sent to my phone. I've never been sent a bill, I've been getting charged every month. But I don't actually know what for. Some months its a bit more or a bit less, but I have no idea why. As I've never been able to see a bill.I got an email this week saying my contract was up. But as I've never been able to log in, I couldn't see the offers. I got so fed up that I couldn't log in so I changed providers. But now they want to charge me a ¬£80 early leaving fee. But I've never seen my contract, so I don't actually know what day it ends on. I think I'm just going to have to take the ¬£80 hit for my sanity. We are just going around and around in circles with customers services. (They always try to be helpful, but we never get anywhere. The AI chatbot that they keep pushing you to on the website is useless though).It just really annoys me, why tell me the contract is ending and then charge me a early leaving fee. ¬£80 is quite a lot money for me. I really feel like there has been an IT issue with my account since I joined that seems to be unfixable.  Edit - The reply below is exactly my point. I get the same script over and over again. Going around and around in circles until I feel like banging my head off a wall. That's why I'm cutting my losses and leaving. Even though I think its grossly unfair that I'm getting charged a leaving fee, when Vodafone told me my contract was finished. I'm losing money now because Vodafone can't seem to fix my account details on your own system. You don't seem to have someone who can actually fix the problem. I think the details were entered incorrectly when I joined, and I don't know what the operator has entered as my details. That's why I can't get anywhere. And why does it have to be done via Facebook or X. Why can't you give people an email address for example.

Review: Avoid Vodafone Broadband ‚Äì Worst Service ExperienceI signed up for Vodafone broadband expecting a smooth switch using their "One Touch" transfer service, which promised a hassle-free, same-day transition. Unfortunately, that couldn‚Äôt be further from the truth. On activation day, I was left with no internet at all.I spent the entire day‚Äî10am to 6pm‚Äîon the phone with Vodafone support, constantly restarting and resetting the modem, with no success. They refused to let me file a formal complaint and left me without service, despite everything working perfectly with my previous provider.I initially chose Vodafone thinking it would be convenient to have broadband and mobile under one bill. Big mistake. I run a home business and rely on internet access for security cameras and daily operations. Vodafone has not only failed to deliver but wasted hours of my time with repetitive, unhelpful steps and no resolution.I'm now cancelling the service after giving them more than enough time to fix the issue. My advice: avoid Vodafone broadband at all costs.

Review: Goodbye Vodafone, a company I've been loyal to for 15 years. I won‚Äôt be back.I never write online reviews. Truly. But after the experience I‚Äôve just had with Vodafone, I felt compelled to make an exception.Let‚Äôs start from the beginning. My phone was stolen in London ‚Äî an unfortunately common occurrence.As part of the usual security protocol, I cancelled all cards that were active on Apple Pay. I went into a Vodafone store the very next day, reported it stolen, and was issued a new SIM card. So far, so good.Then I headed to Apple to sort out a new device. Problem solved? You'd think so, hey.Not a matter of a week later, I began noticing App Store charges coming through on my Vodafone bill ‚Äî not my Apple account. Confused? So was I. How on earth were App Store payments appearing on my Vodafone bill, especially after I had cancelled the linked cards and replaced the SIM?Turns out Vodafone had, without my consent or knowledge, authorised a remote payment sync between my Apple account and Vodafone billing. Something I never agreed to ‚Äî and something that, according to some Vodafone reps, should have been deactivated the moment I reported the phone stolen.I spent a total of six hours on the phone with Vodafone. If I ever hear their hold music again, I might lose my mind. I spoke to countless customer service reps, each with conflicting explanations. Some admitted that the charges should never have gone through. Others tried to shift the blame onto me. All this, despite the fact the charges appeared after I had reported the phone stolen and the SIM replaced.I was told I owed ¬£300. Absolutely not. I refused to pay for a mistake that was clearly theirs. I‚Äôve been a customer for 15 years ‚Äî paying a premium for an overpriced and frankly sub-par service ‚Äî and now I‚Äôm down ¬£2,000 on a new phone and being asked to cover Vodafone‚Äôs screw-up?Eventually, after what felt like hostage negotiations (first they‚Äôd cover 20%, then 50%, then 75%), they finally agreed to remove 100% of the charges. Sounds generous? It wasn‚Äôt. It was damage control ‚Äî for their own mistake. And it took an enormous amount of pressure on my end to get them to do the right thing.This was back in October. So why am I writing this review now?Because it got worse.After clearing the charges, I asked Vodafone to move my account to Pay As You Go, as I‚Äôd recently relocated to the U.S. for 18 months. All seemed fine. Then, during a routine credit check, I discovered a late payment flag from Vodafone had hit my credit score.Baffled, I logged into my account ‚Äî nothing there. I'm on PAYG, so no bills, no charges, no notifications. I call Vodafone again. Guess what? That mysterious late charge? It was from the original bill before they agreed to remove the Apple charges.So despite agreeing to waive the fees ‚Äî again, their error ‚Äî they reported me as having defaulted on a payment. That one flag has now trashed my credit score. For no reason.So here we are. Months of stress, hours of phone calls, gaslighting customer service reps, and a financial headache that‚Äôs still causing ripples.Vodafone: you failed on every front. You mishandled a stolen phone report, tried to make me pay for unauthorised charges, strung me along with inconsistent support, and ultimately damaged my credit over your own mistake.What happened to customer service? What happened to accountability?I‚Äôm done. 15 years of loyalty ‚Äî flushed.Goodbye Vodafone. I won‚Äôt be back.

Review: I was moving house so had a mobile vodaphone wi-fi dongle for the last couple of months as I didn't want to renew the contract I had. When I moved, I phoned to pay my final bill and to give them the required 30 days notice. When I paid my bill, the advisor told me I would have nothing else to pay. I then received a final bill request for ¬£51 which of course, I phoned up to complain about as I had been told I had nothing left to pay. Eventually I managed to get through to an actual person instead of their useless virtual assistant and after a lot of wasted time he agreed to listen to the pohone call but said it would take seven days . He arranged to phone me on the 1st May but didn't. On the 3rd May I got a final bill for ¬£5 which I reluctantly paid. On the 8th May at 11.18 I got another final bill for ¬£35.11 and then at 11.19 I got a third final bill for ¬£14.36 and then got a phone call from the advisor who was supposed to phone me on the 1st May. This company is an absolute disgrace and they make it very hard for you to find out exactly how to complain. You can search their website till you are blue in the face and you won't find a simple email address to complain to. They are not a company I would ever want to deal with again. Just awful.

Review: I recently switched to Vodafone‚Äôs FTTP broadband expecting a more reliable and faster service than my old Sky copper connection. Unfortunately, the opposite has been true.The WiFi range throughout the house has been shockingly poor. I contacted Vodafone support and, instead of resolving the issue, they suggested I pay extra for their SuperWifi plan ‚Äî essentially upselling a fix for a problem that shouldn't exist in the first place.What‚Äôs most frustrating is the customer service. I was repeatedly asked to carry out the same technical tests on the router, even after explaining multiple times that the issue was with coverage, not the line. It‚Äôs baffling that in 2025, a broadband provider can't offer a router that covers a standard household without additional costs.It feels like Vodafone deliberately supplies a subpar router just to push customers into paying more each month. This isn‚Äôt just bad service ‚Äî it‚Äôs bad practice.I regret switching and would caution others to think twice before moving to Vodafone for broadband.Update:I got in touch with Vodafone again through the Facebook link provided and was told to call them just to have the same script narrated to me about how I need boosters for WiFi to work effectively and this time CS advisor was arguing that I cannot compare two providers because the router is not faulty and different routers have different WiFi ranges (when I mentioned Sky's copper broadband giving me better WiFi coverage). I also reviewed all the 'upgrade offers' Vodafone has under my account and again they are actively promoting Superwifi plan so ultimately you pay ¬£4-5 a month extra for boosters which cost less than ¬£10 for Vodafone to continue rent out equipment to make up for their router providing suboptimal coverage. During the phone call I asked to leave Vodafone given I am still within the cooling off period.

Review: I spent over two hours on webchat with customer service after noticing that the broadband deal I signed up for today had already dropped in price by ¬£1 per month. Since I‚Äôm still within the cooling-off period, I reasonably asked if the price could simply be adjusted.Instead, I was told the only option was to cancel the entire contract, return the equipment (installed just hours ago), and then place a new order. I haven‚Äôt even moved into the property yet, so logistically it‚Äôs doable‚Äîbut the policy is unnecessarily rigid and completely inflexible for something so minor.To make things worse, after waiting to be connected to a manager, the chat disappeared with no follow-up. When I asked about how to make a formal complaint, I was told there is no complaints email, making the process deliberately difficult and frustrating.This kind of experience does not inspire confidence. A bit of common sense and flexibility would go a long way.***I don't have social media and don't think I need to create accounts there to file complaints. The complaint process must not be unnecessarily complicated. I expected that someone would have reached out to me given the chat disconnected due to a system glitch, as per the text you've sent. You have my contact details, so feel free to use them.

Review: After years of ineptitude I left this company because of the lost hours spent dealing with being put on hold and transferred between department after department- and having to repeat the problem each time. I cancelled in Feb and they continued to bill me into May. Trying to get a conclusion to this bureaucratic farce proved pointless. I am now going to trading standards and the local press because this shambolic excuse for a company can't even deal with THEIR own problem. Never in my life have I encountered such a useless company. Avoid like the plague if you value your precious time and mental health! BTW....I am still waiting for them to call me back, but I won't hold my breath Update: 8/7/25 They still expect me to chase them on their fb page.....nope! You lot said you would phone me so that's what I expect you to do. I spent 2 hours on the phone for nothing yesterday.  I am DONE chasing you for your mistakes. It's time you took accountability for it. I await your phone call - I will not deal with a bot or 'chat'. Ring me back!

Review: Due to the terminal illness of my brother in the USA, I was called away suddenly, not knowing when I would return. I've been a client with Vodafone for over ten years. As I was departing the UK, I went online and cancelled my Vodafone via their cancellation link. Within minutes I received confirmation of this, but once stateside some days later received a bill for my monthly service. I am not on a contract and was fully paid up with some days left when I cancelled. On April 7th, having been busy with family illness, I received a bill from Vodafone for my continuing service which I had cancelled weeks earlier and not used since. I went online to Vodafone chat. This began with several minutes of the agent asking if I had any special needs or if there was anything they needed to be made aware of about my circumstance. I made it clear that I left the UK because my brother was terminally ill, with the intent (and notification of) my phone cancellation. I was told that since I didn't apply my STAC number to another phone provider I would be billed until I cancelled (apparently cancellation isn't really cancellation after all!). So on April 7th I cancelled for the second time. Despite my family emergency and traumatic situation, I received no sympathy or support from Vodafone. I might as well have chatted with a bot. Vodafone 'customer care' is cynical and appalling. Next I get a message some days later saying I owed them ¬£17.81 for an overdue balance. For a phone which had not been used and for which the contract had been cancelled a month prior! Busy with other matters (life and death!) I did not immediately attend to this demand for a service I was no longer receiving. Today I received a fresh demand. I now owe ¬£39.98 for an inactive account I have cancelled twice! As it happens my monthly pay as you go was ¬£9 each month; I never went over and I always paid on time. Such blatant profiteering from grief is despicable. When I went online to see what these charges are ... as they are clearly so inflated ... my online account has been deactivated and is inaccessible. So I could just keep paying and paying, for a service I am not receiving at a rate that is re-inflating every few weeks. What a disgusting, corrupt organisation. This is how they pay customer loyalty. And this is how they support their clients. UPDATE: Whilst I appreciate the Vodafone Social Media Team getting in touch, this is a hollow attempt at resolving the problem after I had shown a light on it. I just attempted to contact Vodafone via the link on X provided ... waited an hour for a reply! I was a client in good standing, cancelled my phone service in the way Vodafone set forth, and despite all my efforts, in the hopes of putting things right, I was forced to spent over a half hour on Chat with the 'Vodafone Team' who displayed neither empathy nor genuine interest in understanding my situation or assisting me. The default response from Vodafone seems to be 'just keep charging the client, over and over again without listening.' I now have an email for an amount that has not been explained to me ... and a threat that it will all be turned over to a debt collection agency. A debit sheet where their human concern should be. Now I have filed a formal complaint with Vodafone. Let's see what happens.
Name: Jesse

Review: Terrible customer serviceI ordered the broadband service on 7th April 2025 to replace my BT home broadband (SoGEA) and phone service. Gave them my address and telephone number to keep.I have a business as well and have a dedicated BT business line that is already on FTTP so understand that an engineer would need to visit to install the fibre service and disconnect the old cable connection.I recieved an email from BT telling me as I was out of contract i would not pay anything and my home broadband and phone would stop when i move to vodafone.Yesterday (6th May) my home broadband stopped working, no engineer and then my business broadband stopped working. I was told by vodafone that the connection can take upto 24 hours to activate.So today, still no vodafone at home and no BT business broadband at the office. I decide to take the vodafone router to the business and low and behold it works. So openreach have decided to take over a business FTTP connection and disconnect a SoGEA one at the same time.On the phone to vodafone for over an hour with the egyptian staff member (Abdul) telling me it is working at the address listed with the telephone number. I ask to make a complaint to wait another 30 mins be to asked what resolution i would like (BT OR to install FTTP at the house and reconnect BT business at the office!?!?!) After the call ending and speaking to someone else still nothing after OVER 3 HOURS apart from a manager may call within 24-48 hours.This has serverly impacted my business and I will be looking to leave vodsfone at the earliest opportunity.I will be sending a complaint in writing to your CEO (Max Taylor) as well as Ofcom.**** update****After spending hours on the phone with poorly trained staff (asking for a serial number of the router and a video call to show the router is not working in its intended location) i havr given up. Vodafone will lose my business, i am trying to get BT business to send an engineer to take over the line again. Vodafone could have sorted this by sending an Openreach engineer to install an fttp connection at the correct location.

Review: I called Vodafone UK to cancel my phone service after using their service for over 2 years. Great connection throughout the time and everything great. However, since I am moving aboard, I called them in Jan 2025 and confirmed with the person on the phone that everything has been cancelled and there's nothing else that I have to do. They asked me to keep my direct debit opened just in case there's any final fee. I then noticed that they continue charging me for Feb and Mar hence I stopped my direct debit. They then started emailing me threatening me that if I do not pay my overdue payment, contract termination fees will be applied, a default being registered with the credit reference agencies, which may make it difficult for me to get loans, credit cards and other phone contracts in the future. I no longer live in the UK but contacted them back to see whats the issue since this shouldn't have happened and hoping for a refund. They then deny anything I told them about the call in Jan 2025 and said I cannot cancel my service until I pay my monthly bill plus extra 5 pound for late payment. I was shocked but still wanting to settle this just in case I need to return to the UK again. This staff on the online chat named Arun took half an hour to verify my identity, replying every 2 mins. Then doing it all again after I pay the fee and transferring me to the cancellation team. At this point I have lost 3 months bills pus extra 5 pound for no reason and now they said that they have cancelled it again and there's nothing that I have do...

Review: Vodafone are in a mess. After being a cusotmer for a few years and having three plans with them, I tried to upgrade and order a new phone. I signed all the documents, all the informaiton asked of me was provided. Despite their App crashing and having to call back, which I did, I jumped through every hoop they asked me to. I chased the order through only to find they hadn't processed it. They then quoted me totally different numbers and finally cancelled the phone order but left me with an updated SIM order which, without the phone is a pretty pointless thing to do. I've spend over 1.5 hours on the phone to them today and It's so difficult to get anyone to read the notes. They can't find transcripts from their own app and have no knowledge of the contracts I've signed, even though I offered them copies of their own documents. I'm utterly shocked that a business with such a strong following, is retaining customers if this is how they treat them.

Review: If I could give 0, I literally would. Left me and my partner without a broadband 15 extra days after moving to a new home (when we both WORK FROM HOME!!!!!) due to a fault on their behalf, which resulted in us having to buy extra data to make sure we can work still. And yet no compensation for the distress caused. I have called multiple times, and they have said because there is no automatic compensation applied, they can‚Äôt do anything. I have requested to speak to a manager multiple times, they always have to arrange a call back and surprise, surprise, they only call when I work in the office. Absolutely shocking to be honest. They have no email address so you can‚Äôt even email anyone. You can only write a letter because calling at this point is so pointless. I will be writing a letter, if nothing changes Ombudsman it is. Promising a service and then leaving us for an extra two weeks with no compensation for the mess caused, and then point blank refusing to compensate for the distress caused by is absurd. Definitely a breach of CRA 2015, and I won‚Äôt rest until I am satisfied with an outcome. UPDATE IN RESPONSE TO VODAFONES COMMENT: I have called multiple times with no resolution, I have spoke to your Facebook team that redirected me to call anyway lol, and I have spoken on the chat bot thing. NO ONE is coming to a solution for us.

Review: I am surprised to see how many of you have given this company top marks. How many of you have checked your down load upload speeds? Well I have and found the following, I singed up for a 900MB connection and got the following between 200 and 390 MB depending on the time of day. I have complained numerus times, they have tested from their end and tell me would you believe that I am always getting  455 MB. Apparently it is Legal to advertise a connection then only give you half of what your paying for according to Vodaphone.  If your happy to pay for a certain speed and only get half of what your paying at best that is fine but not for me. I would therefore suggest you check your speed by downloading Ookla  free speed test its easy to use and will give you a very accurate result.
Name: Alan Bedford

Review: Honestly, one of the most backwards companies I have ever dealt with. First, I‚Äôm told my contract has ended and no further payments will be taken. Then, a few days later, they take money from my account anyway.Naturally, I call to ask why, only to be told about a supposed 30-day closure policy. I understand terms and conditions, but when I‚Äôm explicitly informed that my contract has ended and no further payments will be charged, then money is taken anyway‚Äîit‚Äôs an absolute joke.The punchline? They want yet another payment just to close my account! Ridiculous. I‚Äôve cancelled my direct debit, so good luck getting another penny from me. Maybe focus on understanding your own processes before throwing them in customers' faces.

Review: Vodafone broadband. I genuinely believe that the call centre staff do not look at your account when you telephone them. I needed to change my banking details as my old bank was closing down. I telephoned the call centre three times at the beginning of April and was assured that there was no issue with my account. I even provided a different account to take payment from. With no notice Vodafhone cut off my internet boardband just before five on Friday 2 May, when I telephoned I was told different things by every different call handler I spoke to. I feel really let down. It took three days for my broadband connection to be restored, eventhough it was their mistake. I will not trust them again and I will start to look for a new broadband service provider. I also intend to sue them for my losses as this is the only way this company will listen.

Review: Note to Vodafone Social Media Team in response to my previous review of your organisation.I am not on Facebook nor X, therefore the onus is on YOU to resolve this matter. I spent over 2 3/4 hours on your live chat facility and on the telephone to your organisation, collectively, yesterday trying to sort out this matter and reach a satisfactory conclusion but instead I get advised to send an email to a third-party affiliate (which I've done) as Vodafone have decided to take no ownership or responsibility for a technical glitch on their website when I tried to purchase Broadband that has prevented me from receiving the promotional e-giftcard voucher.I've also been in contact with Giftcloud and Broadband comparison websites with a view to finally ascertaining a resolution, but still I am getting nowhere.I am 86 years old and never thought I'd still be fighting the fight at my age to get justice on a matter that is not my fault.I just want to enjoy the rest of my life in peace and without unnecessary barriers being put in my way.

Review: We had been experiencing issues with our contracts at Vodafone, and first attempted to resolve it through their online customer support.After an appalling attitude from one customer service agent who made an inappropriate comment, we decided to head into a store.We were greeted by Lorna, a personable, knowledgeable and helpful individual who was enthusiastic to resolve our existing  problems. After hearing the details of our previous experience with online customer support, they swiftly assisted in filing a complaint, and the issue was later concluded. Lorna furthermore demonstrated excellent levels of professionalism, clearly outlining how we could make changes to our contracts where it was lacklustre explained online. After this visit, we had further issues with a separate Vodafone contract, and went in-store on Monday 5th May 2025 after 3 back-and-forth calls with the online customer support team last week to no avail.Despite it being late in the day, and on a bank holiday, we were warmly greeted by Lorna who once again saved the day. Lorna immediately remedied the issue, pointing out an error that was present with the details of the contract. Both of these experiences in-store have been wonderful, with clear communication, sound knowledge of Vodafone policies, friendly and professional demeanour, and a genuine resolution to the issues we were facing. A true 5*, and 10/10 customer experience from Lorna. Thank you!
Name: S

Review: I have been a Vodafone customer for over 15 years now and this is by far the worst customer experience I have ever had to go through. I state the years, as it counts for absolutely nothing to them. Unfortunately, when companies are so big, it is easy to fall between the cracks and you are truly just a number (no pun intended). I went for a simple upgrade on the 14th April and my new phone was meant to turn up the next day. No phone, no update, just DPD telling me that it was delayed in transit. Over the next couple of days, Vodafone had no update for me. I was then told that I had to wait for 6 working days for DPD to do a full investigation. On the 6th working day, I called Vodafone and they confirmed it had been lost (the phone call was an hour and 20 mins long and I was on hold for an hour and 10 mins of that time and not once did the agent come back on the line). I eventually got the chance to ask if they can send a new phone now, seeing as the outcome had been confirmed, which they said no. They have to close down the matter their side and a further escalation has to happen within Vodafone and that I'll get a phone call within 2 working days. A few days later, my phone call never came from the escalation team. By this point I am now 2 weeks without a phone and have spent over 4 hours on live chat and phone calls. I emailed over a very candid message and someone called me within 20 mins of that message. I was told to wait 2 more days for them to close the order and that they would call me. The 2 days passed on Friday 2nd May. I am still awaiting a new phone with tomorrow marking the 3 week anniversary. I write this review to not only show the ineptitude of Vodafone and their complete and utter lack of care for their customers but also so people contemplating upgrading or using Vodafone for the first time, to reconsider and go elsewhere, it's just not worth it, even just for their protocols alone. You will be left and forgotten about. Edit: to respond to the comments below and for clarity to the reader, this is an official complaint and was raised on the 25th April. It's now the 6th May.....still no response.
Name: Mike

Review: Today , a staff member at the Vodafone shop helped me a lot. Her name was Aisha. She was very patient, kind, helpful, and provided sincere assistance and guidance.

Review: I want to get this out there with anyone who is thinking of joining vodafone or are currently either with them or disconnecting from them... when you're with them, things seem to be okay, no issues unless you need customer support, but by christ, you need deep pockets if you're thinking of leaving.. my partner has been stung twice in this situation. Once with her phone, secondly with her WiFi. On both occasions vodafone had mentioned that contracts have been completely paid off but later on emailed her demanding money months later down the line. With a bill of exactly ¬£178 twice! Not one warning...not one warning at all, nearly setting her back ¬£500 on contracts that together dont reach ¬£60 a month! Absolutely rubbish customer service! But a company thay simply takes money from people with no care in the world, sort it out.. disgusting. Don't go with vodafone if you want your moneys worth for anything. Go to EE they offer better coverage too

Various calls to and from Vodafone, probably between us six to eight calls and yet it‚Äôs now 5.22pm and still no internet. My mother has a heart monitor machine for her ICD that requires internet,  being elderly they rely on broadband for tv and to use video calls and check their emails, they‚Äôre pretty much cut off. They are visiting the Vodafone shop tomorrow to see if they get anywhere as there‚Äôs onlySo many times they can go through the troubleshooting, reset machine turn off and on, put a pin in the pin hole of the router and wait etc etc‚Ä¶.. not sure when they plan to sort it or even if they plan toBut these guys are unbelievable , never had customer service so bad

Review: Dreadful customer service. I have been with Vodafone for both my mobile and broadband for more years than i care to remember. I could view both my mobile and broadband bills on the app, a good service.That was until i bought another mobile contract from another provider but it was a totally new contract with Vodafone.All of a sudden I had a problem. I could only view my mobile bill, i didn't receive my together discount which they promote if you have both mobile contract and broadband contract with them, i also dont get the together offers on the app, these are the bonus offers on Myvodafone app. For nearly a full year now I have spent an inordinate amount of time on live chat(2 hours at a time) attempting to get them to merge both my broadband and mobile to one account. Yesterday 1 spent another 1.5 hours on to their customer services, they passed me between different depts, one told me he couldnt merge my accounts as i had to fill in a form asking them to merge both accounts. I filled in this form 8 months ago and told him that. He then kept me waiting 15 mins whilst he checked, he then confirmed i wasn't lying and they had the form but nothing had been done with it!! Next he told me he'd have to transfer me to another department as my credit check was outdated???? What? I have had my mobile with vodafone for around 15 years, broadband for 5 in my current home.He was basically fobbing me off, i dont think he knew how to merge the accounts. How hard can it be? I asked to speak to his Manager, he kept me waiting 10 mins then asked me to explain what i thought his Manager could do for me? At that, I gave up. I told him it'd be easier to take my business elsewhere, they are nowhere near the cheapest anyway. I wouldn't under any circumstances recommend vodafone to anybody due to their complete lack of customer care. In fact I'd go further and actively discourage anybody i know from using them, simply because of a complete lack of interest in a customers needs.Please go elsewhere because if you don't have a ridiculous amount of spare time to talk to their customer services, you have no choice but to resigb yourself to the fact, issues will not be sorted by vodafone. Dreadful company. I'll find a new provider this weekend, i give up on them. My mobile will move too when i'm out of contract.  ***UpdateVodafone have responded, unbelievably they spelled my name incorrectly and even more unbelievably, they have suggested I contact them, by LIVE CHAT would you believe. My god, what has happened to this company. Kind regards BRIAN. Not Brain

Review: Do not choose Vodafone Broadband. Until recently I had been happy with my home broadband, but in the past couple of weeks dealing with the service has become a nightmare. Apparently someone (unknown, certainly NOT me) requested a new provider so Vodafone contacted me "sorry you're leaving etc etc). I contacted customer service, tried phone and then resorted to the online chat service, and after numerous different agents was eventually reassured that this was all an error and my service would not be disconnected, however as of yesterday I have no broadband at home and despite wasting another couple of hours between chatbots and phone (I was cut off the call after 40 minutes!!) I am no further. I cannot work from home and they are apparently going to bill me ¬£111.39 as an early termination fee for a disconnect that I have explained repeatedly I did not request. Noone seems to be able to sort this out, and they called it a 'seized line' I was offered a whole new account and a 2 week wait for what should have been a continuous service. Dealing with this company is one of the most frustrating experiences.*UPDATE* Now almost three weeks before connection and as I do not have a Vodafone mobile they have washed their hands of providing me with any alternative in the interim.  Apparently company policy precludes sending me anything like a wifi dongle. That would be too useful.  I also have to contact them again when the termination fee appears as they will have to manually reverse it. I have had to set up an entirely new account. This has taken about 7 hours of online chats; almost a whole working day. I could weep.
Name: Michelle

Review: Thank you to Alex and Matt at the WiganGrand Arcade store for the great customer service and helping me go through my options your a credit to the store you enjoy the job you do and the service was with a smile to all the customers (it was busy) thank you Rebecca.

Review: Vodafone must be the worst company for broadband so far. Was promised to get connected on 28th of April and so far on May 2nd no Internet. I work from home so this is incredibly frustrating having no access to the Internet.  Having been on the phone to them more than 10 times, they're no closer to solving the problem than in the beginning. Initially they blamed open reach before admitting that the " order hasn't been completed" by them despite having sent all the necessary equipment and not once during setup did they mention that they would need to be called. I called them again and requested to speak to the manager in which I was promised a phone call but many hours later no one called me. Still without Internet for the weekend. Very shambolic company. I wouldn't wish Vodafone broadband on my worst enemy. To add salt to the wound, apparently I can't cancel the contract until it's services is live, hence I'm at their mercy. Avoid like a plague.

Review: Never use Vodafone! I have never actually used Vodafone, but after my partner‚Äôs experience I certainly NEVER will! He has had the worst possible experience from a huge and well known company. They charged him for 2 broadband packages without his knowledge and their ineptitude in resolving a phone line not working resulted in his business missing important calls from customers. After multiple contacts with them and promises of compensation, he has had nothing. The latest in this farce is that the compensation owed cannot be sent to him due to admin errors! I would have thought that a multi million pound company would be able to sort such simple problems. What ludicrous customer service and how embarrassing for the staff that work there. It will be nice when one day we won‚Äôt have to complain about more Vodafone tomfoolery!
Name: EllieLeech

Review: It got worse. The mobile was found to be ready after all, but when I got home and opened the box, someone had slung in the wrong kind of charger. I give up. The contract is getting cancelled. Who takes all that money and sets up a contract then supplies the wrong items? Well, it happens, but the level of argument from the team recommended by the response below is off the scale. No, they couldn't look up the details of the phone and simply send me a proper charger. It's a poor outlook in the event of more issues.***Everything happened quickly after Vodafone responded (below). Whereas the customer services adviser had said I couldn't collect the phone until tomorrow, suddenly a message came - it was ready after all. Having seen the laconic attitude in the Braintree store twice this week, I'd guess they simply couldn't be bothered to arrange collection today. Not until they got chased following my TP comments.***I'm waiting for a new phone which was promised for today. No text has arrived, and clearly, it isn't ready to collect. A call to customer services got me an email address and I sent a message, to which no one has responded from the shop in Braintree. Then a demand to fill in a survey arrived. The customer service assistant then called me, to urge me to fill it in. I explained, I had deleted it since the process was not complete, and she made me feel guilty. I suggested she might resubmit it but she was dismayed and said she could not. This isn't my fault. All I want is the proper service, which I was promised on Wednesday.

Review: Do not use Vodafone. Amongst other issues, it turns out they've been charging me twice for broadband every month. After looking into it I was owed over ¬£300 by Vodafone who admitted an admin error and advised the refund would be back in my account within 30 days. 30 days go by, still no refund. I contacted Vodafone, again. To be told there was another admin error and the refund wasn't processed. I'd need to wait another 30 days for my refund. I advised this wasn't acceptable and I wanted a bank refund within 24 hours. This came to a deadlock with their only solution being, the refund will be back in 30 days. How can a huge, multi million pound company be comfortable with taking money from regular customers. You're a joke Vodafone.
Name: Joel Palmer
